eg.ui

Class EditArea

  • java.lang.Object
    • eg.ui.EditArea

  • public final class EditArea
extends java.lang.Object
    The editor view that defines a JPanel that contains the text area for editing text and the area that displays line numbers

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      EditArea(boolean isWordwrap, boolean isLineNumbers, java.lang.String font, int fontSize) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void disableWordwrap(boolean isLineNumbers)
      Disables wordwrap and makes the area that displays line numbers visible if the specified boolean is true
      javax.swing.JPanel editAreaPnl()
      Gets this JPanel which contains the area for editing text and the area that shows line numbers
      void enableWordwrap()
      Enables wordwrap.
      boolean isWordwrap()
      Returns if wordwrap is enabled
      javax.swing.JTextPane lineNrArea()
      Gets this text area that displays the line numbers
      LineNrWidthAdaptable lineNrWidth()
      Gets this implemented method that is specified in LineNrWidthAdaptable
      void print()
      Prints the text content in this text area to a printer
      void setFont(java.lang.String font, int fontSize)
      Sets the font in this area for editing text and this area that displays line numbers
      void showLineNumbers(boolean b)
      Shows or hides the area that displays line numbers, depending on the specified boolean value
      javax.swing.JTextPane textArea()

    • Constructor Detail

      • EditArea

        public EditArea(boolean isWordwrap,
                boolean isLineNumbers,
                java.lang.String font,
                int fontSize)
        Parameters:
        isWordwrap - true to enable, false to disable wordwrap.
        isLineNumbers - true to show, false to hide line numbers. This is effectless if isWordwrap is true.
        font - the name of the initial font
        fontSize - the size of the initial font

        Gets this JPanel which contains the area for editing text and the area that shows line numbers
        Returns:
        this edit area panel

        Returns:

      • isWordwrap

        public boolean isWordwrap()
        Returns if wordwrap is enabled
        Returns:
        the boolean value

      • showLineNumbers

        public void showLineNumbers(boolean b)
        Shows or hides the area that displays line numbers, depending on the specified boolean value
        Parameters:
        b - the boolean valie. True to show
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if wordwrap is currently enabled

      • enableWordwrap

        public void enableWordwrap()
        Enables wordwrap. Invoking this method also hides the area that displays line numbers

      • disableWordwrap

        public void disableWordwrap(boolean isLineNumbers)
        Disables wordwrap and makes the area that displays line numbers visible if the specified boolean is true
        Parameters:
        isLineNumbers - the boolean value

      • setFont

        public void setFont(java.lang.String font,
                    int fontSize)
        Sets the font in this area for editing text and this area that displays line numbers
        Parameters:
        font - the name of the font
        fontSize - the font size

      • print

        public void print()
        Prints the text content in this text area to a printer
